document_data.caption: Various depictions of nagas
document_data.name: Naga
document_data.challenge3e: {{CR table|edition=3|Dark naga|8|Guardian naga|10|Iridescent naga|8|Spirit naga|9|Water naga|7}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Nagas''' ({{Pronounce|NA|gaz|refs=<ref>{{Cite dragon/93/Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd|28}}}}) were serpentine creatures of great intellect and natural mastery of sorcery.
document_data.Description: Nagas resembled giant [[snake]]s with heads that bore a [[humanoid]] resemblance. They typically ranged from {{SIrange|10|20|ft|long=yes}} in length and weighed around {{SIrange|200|500|lbs.|k}}. Though some were known to be over a {{SI|100|ft|long=yes}} in length.

Abilities.Biology:
Though nagas and their deities were perceived as having distinct sexes, they were an entirely hermaphrodite species. A naga could reproduce by copulating with another member of their subrace or simply by impregnating itself. No method was preferred over the other and the choice of method came down to convenience or personal preference.

Much like most snake and reptile species, nagas were known to dislike cold climates.

document_data.History:
Nagas were created by the [[sarrukh]] in the early days of [[Mhairshaulk]] as a servitor race. They were created by magically interbreeding powerful [[serpent]]s with the natural intelligence and inquisitiveness of [[human]]s. In their capacity as servitors they served the sarrukh as guards, researchers of magic, and explorers of uncharted lands.

The first nagas to be created were [[water naga]]s, who were bred for the purpose of exploring the vast lands and oceans of [[Abeir-Toril]]. Over time, the nagas helped the sarrukh to establish the foundations of magic in the kingdoms of Mhairshaulk, [[Isstosseffifi]], [[Okoth]].

[[File:Bone naga 3e.jpg|thumb|250px|right|''A bone naga.'']]

Subspecies of Naga.Minor Subspecies:
*[[Banelar naga]]
*[[Bright naga]]
*[[Ha-naga]]
*[[Nagahydra]]

There was a particular undead form of naga called [[bone naga]]s, normally created as guardians.<ref>

A similar-looking creature created by spirit nagas as servitors was the [[nagatha]].<ref>

Society.Religion:
Prior to his fragmentation, all nagas worshiped the [[World Serpent]]. Some theologians speculated that their curiosity and questioning over his many facets was what led to him fragmenting.

Following the World Serpent's fragmentation and the fall of Mhairshaulk most nagas worshiped [[Shekinester]], a lesser goddess that fragmented from him, and her son [[Parrafaire]]. Banelar nagas were known to worship either [[Bane]] or [[Cyric]].
Society.Magic: Lesser ''[[kiira]]'', or "lore gems", were commonly created and used by nagas.
